TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SequentialActivityDesigner extends System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.StructuredCompositeActivityDesigner

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Defines properties and methods for all activity designers that have a sequential vertical layout on the workflow design surface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]
The SequentialActivityDesigner and classes that inherit from it can contain child activity designers. Their appearance on the workflow design surface is organized vertically, with child activities displayed on the surface of the SequentialActivityDesigner.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets an that allows the to adjust its UI for users who have disabilities.
Docs.value: The to associate with the designer.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the initial value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> is a null reference (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner> creates an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the can be expanded and collapsed on the workflow designer surface.
Docs.value: if the designer can be expanded and collapsed on the workflow design surface; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If CanExpandCollapse returns `true`, the designer renders an expand-collapse button on the workflow design surface.
If the parent designer of the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner> is <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.ParallelActivityDesigner>, CanExpandCollapse returns `false`. Additionally, if the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner> is the root designer, CanExpandCollapse returns `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public override bool Expanded { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the designer is expanded on the workflow design surface.
Docs.value: if the is expanded on the workflow design surface; otherwise, . The default is .

Docs.summary: Gets the first selectable object in the navigation order of the .
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Object> that is the first selectable object in the designer navigation order.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Drawing.Rectangle[] GetConnectors() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of rectangles that bound the activity designer's connectors.
Docs.returns: The array that bounds the connectors.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the current designer is not the active designer or if the designer is not expanded, GetConnectors returns an empty array. If there are no activity designers in the parent designer, GetConnectors returns an array of one rectangle.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual string HelpText { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text to display when the contains no other activity designers.
Docs.value: A string that contains the text to display on the designer surface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The HelpText property value is displayed on the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner> surface when it contains no child activity designers.

Docs.summary: Gets the rectangle that serves as the bounds for the text displayed by the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner.HelpText%2A> property.
Docs.value: A that serves as the bounds for the text displayed by the <xref:System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.SequentialActivityDesigner.HelpText%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Gets the height and width of the text to display in the when it contains no child activity designers.
Docs.value: The that defines the height and width of the text displayed by when it contains no child activity designers. By default HelpTextSize is set to a newly initialized .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Design.HitTestInfo HitTest(valuetype System.Drawing.Point point) cil managed

Docs.param: The location on the workflow design surface from which to gather information.
Docs.summary: Returns information about the at the specified point on the workflow design surface.
Docs.returns: A that contains information about the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The information returned by HitTest is based on the point on the workflow design surface that was passed to it. It includes the activity designer associated with the point, the bounds of that activity designer, the exact hit location of the point, any selectable objects associated with the point, and any user data associated with the point.
